files.match_string:
LoginData loginData = new LoginData(email, password);
        Log.d("ovaa", "Processing " + loginData);

summaries.method: This code defines a method that processes a login using provided email and password, sends a login request using Retrofit, saves the login data, and calls a method to handle login completion.
summaries.class: The provided code implements a login functionality where users can enter their email and password, process the login, and redirect to a specified activity upon successful login.
summaries.cluster: This cluster of Java methods is responsible for handling login functionality by saving credentials, processing login, and managing login-related activities such as callbacks and redirections.

summaries.method: This code defines a method that processes a login using provided email and password, sends a login request using Retrofit, saves the login data, and calls a method to handle login completion.
summaries.class: The provided code implements a login functionality where users can enter their email and password, process the login, and redirect to a specified activity upon successful login.
summaries.cluster: This cluster of Java methods is responsible for handling login functionality by saving credentials, processing login, and managing login-related activities such as callbacks and redirections.

metadata.cwe: CWE-532: Insertion of Sensitive Information into Log File
metadata.description: The App logs information. Please ensure that sensitive information is never logged.
A hardcoded password in plain text is identified.

summaries.method: The code provides a method to encrypt a given string using the AES encryption algorithm and returns the encrypted data as a base64 encoded string.
summaries.class: The code defines a class named WeakCrypto with a static method that encrypts data using AES encryption with a hardcoded key and returns the encrypted data encoded in Base64 format, handling exceptions by returning an empty string.
summaries.cluster: The cluster of Java methods includes functions for querying login data, managing Retrofit instance, encrypting data using AES, and handling singleton instance of LoginUtils.

metadata.cwe: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
metadata.description: Calling Cipher.getInstance("AES") will return AES ECB mode by default. ECB mode is known to be weak as it results in the same ciphertext for identical blocks of plaintext.

summaries.method: The code provides a method to encrypt a given string using the AES encryption algorithm and returns the encrypted data as a base64 encoded string.
summaries.class: The code defines a class named WeakCrypto with a static method that encrypts data using AES encryption with a hardcoded key and returns the encrypted data encoded in Base64 format, handling exceptions by returning an empty string.
summaries.cluster: The cluster of Java methods includes functions for querying login data, managing Retrofit instance, encrypting data using AES, and handling singleton instance of LoginUtils.

metadata.cwe: CWE-321: Use of Hard-coded Cryptographic Key
metadata.description: Hardcoded encryption key makes AES symmetric encryption useless. An attacker can easily reverse engineer the application and recover the keys.
This flag allows anyone to backup your application data via adb. It allows users who have enabled USB debugging to copy application data off of the device.
This app does not have capabilities to prevent against Screenshots from Recent Task History/ Now On Tap etc.

metadata.cwe: CWE-353: Missing Support for Integrity Check
metadata.description: This app does not uses SafetyNet Attestation API that provides cryptographically-signed attestation, assessing the device's integrity. This check helps to ensure that the servers are interacting with the genuine app running on a genuine Android device.
This app does not have capabilities to prevent tapjacking attacks. An attacker can hijack the user's taps and tricks him into performing some critical operations that he did not intend to.
This app does not have root detection capabilities. Running a sensitive application on a rooted device questions the device integrity and affects users data.

This app does not use a TLS/SSL certificate or public key pinning in code to detect or prevent MITM attacks in secure communication channel. Please verify if pinning is enabled in `network_security_config.xml`.

This app does not enforce TLS Certificate Transparency that helps to detect SSL certificates that have been mistakenly issued by a certificate authority or maliciously acquired from an otherwise unimpeachable certificate authority.
